raw_text:
UI/UX
 
Project
 
Scope
 
Document
 
Project
 
Title:
 
CampusConnect
 
—
 
Student
 
Life
 
Companion
 
App
 
1.
 
Project
 
Overview
 
CampusConnect
 
is
 
a
 
mobile-first
 
platform
 
aimed
 
at
 
simplifying
 
and
 
enriching
 
the
 
daily
 
lives
 
of
 
university
 
students
 
by
 
consolidating
 
academic
 
schedules,
 
club
 
activities,
 
events,
 
and
 
campus
 
resources
 
into
 
a
 
single
 
intuitive
 
interface.
 
The
 
primary
 
goal
 
of
 
this
 
project
 
is
 
to
 
deliver
 
a
 
seamless,
 
accessible,
 
and
 
delightful
 
user
 
experience
 
through
 
thoughtful
 
UI/UX
 
design.
 
 
2.
 
Objectives
 
of
 
the
 
UI/UX
 
Project
 
●
 
Create
 
an
 
intuitive
 
and
 
aesthetically
 
pleasing
 
interface
 
that
 
supports
 
a
 
wide
 
range
 
of
 
student
 
users.
 
 
●
 
Ensure
 
quick
 
access
 
to
 
critical
 
features
 
like
 
timetable,
 
upcoming
 
events,
 
and
 
club
 
communications.
 
 
●
 
Optimize
 
usability
 
across
 
multiple
 
devices
 
(mobile-first,
 
tablet,
 
and
 
web).
 
 
●
 
Minimize
 
cognitive
 
load
 
and
 
maximize
 
user
 
engagement
 
through
 
clear
 
visual
 
hierarchy
 
and
 
interactive
 
design
 
patterns.
 
 
 
3.
 
Project
 
Deliverables
 
Phase
 
Deliverable
 
Discovery
 
-
 
Stakeholder
 
Interviews
 
-
 
User
 
Personas
 
-
 
Journey
 
Maps
 
-
 
Competitive
 
Analysis
 
Design
 
-
 
Low-Fidelity
 
Wireframes
 
-
 
High-Fidelity
 
Mockups
 
-
 
Clickable
 
Prototypes
 
Validation
 
-
 
Usability
 
Testing
 
Reports
 
-
 
UX
 
Heuristics
 
Review
 
Handoff
 
-
 
Design
 
System
 
-
 
Annotated
 
UI
 
Screens
 
-
 
Developer
 
Handoff
 
via
 
Figma
 
or
 
Zeplin
 
 
4.
 
Functional
 
Scope
 
(UI
 
Focus)
 
●
 
Navigation
 
Structure
:
 
Bottom
 
navigation
 
with
 
contextual
 
quick
 
actions.
 
 
●
 
Dashboard/Home
 
Screen
:
 
Personalized
 
widgets
 
showing
 
class
 
schedule,
 
event
 
updates,
 
and
 
deadlines.
 
 
●
 
Club
 
Portal
:
 
Browse
 
clubs,
 
join
 
groups,
 
RSVP
 
to
 
events.
 
 
●
 
Calendar
 
Integration
:
 
Visual,
 
interactive
 
calendar
 
with
 
drag-drop
 
support.
 
 
●
 
Notification
 
Center
:
 
Clean,
 
categorized
 
alerts
 
for
 
academic
 
and
 
extracurricular
 
updates.
 
 
●
 
Profile
 
Settings
:
 
Customization
 
of
 
interests,
 
themes,
 
and
 
notification
 
preferences.
 
 
 
5.
 
UX
 
Scope
 
(Experience
 
Focus)
 
●
 
User
 
Research
:
 
Surveys
 
and
 
interviews
 
with
 
30+
 
students
 
from
 
3
 
departments.
 
 
●
 
Information
 
Architecture
:
 
Sitemap
 
optimized
 
for
 
minimal
 
clicks
 
to
 
core
 
features.
 
 
●
 
Accessibility
 
Standards
:
 
WCAG
 
2.1
 
compliance;
 
support
 
for
 
screen
 
readers
 
and
 
high-contrast
 
mode.
 
 
●
 
Micro-interactions
:
 
Animations
 
for
 
transitions,
 
loading
 
states,
 
and
 
feedback.
 
 
●
 
Onboarding
 
Flow
:
 
First-time
 
user
 
experience
 
with
 
tutorial
 
overlays
 
and
 
smart
 
tips.
 
 
 
6.
 
Out
 
of
 
Scope
 
●
 
Backend
 
development,
 
APIs,
 
and
 
data
 
storage
 
 
●
 
Content
 
creation
 
(club/event
 
descriptions)
 
 
●
 
In-app
 
payment
 
systems
 
 
●
 
AI-based
 
recommendations
 
(planned
 
for
 
V2)
 
 
 
7.
 
Timeline
 
(Design
 
Phases
 
Only)
 
Phase
 
Duration
 
Discovery
 
&
 
Research
 
2
 
weeks
 
Wireframing
 
&
 
Prototyping
 
2
 
weeks
 
Usability
 
Testing
 
&
 
Iterations
 
1
 
week
 
Final
 
UI
 
&
 
Developer
 
Handoff
 
1
 
week
 
 
8.
 
Tools
 
&
 
Platforms
 
●
 
Design
 
Tools
:
 
Figma,
 
Adobe
 
XD
 
 
●
 
Collaboration
:
 
Notion,
 
Miro
 
 
●
 
Testing
:
 
Maze,
 
Lookback
 
 
●
 
Handoff
:
 
Zeplin,
 
Figma
 
Dev
 
Mode
 
 
 
9.
 
Success
 
Metrics
 
●
 
80%+
 
Task
 
Success
 
Rate
 
in
 
usability
 
tests
 
 
●
 
15%
 
increase
 
in
 
student
 
engagement
 
within
 
1
 
month
 
post-launch
 
 
●
 
Reduction
 
in
 
onboarding
 
time
 
to
 
under
 
2
 
minutes
 
 
●
 
90%+
 
satisfaction
 
score
 
in
 
post-launch
 
feedback
 
 
 
10.
 
Stakeholders
 
●
 
Product
 
Owner:
 
College
 
Admin
 
Team
 
 
●
 
Primary
 
Users:
 
Undergraduate
 
Students
 
(Age
 
18–23)
 
 
●
 
Secondary
 
Users:
 
Club
 
Heads,
 
Faculty
 
Advisors
 
 
●
 
UI/UX
 
Design
 
Team:
 
1
 
UX
 
Researcher,
 
1
 
UI
 
Designer,
 
1
 
UX
 
Writer
